intro.description:
A transaction creates an automatic navigation in the website op a project and executes certain instructions. Each time Convertigo detects a screen class with extractions rules, the result of extractions with its classes is added to the exit.
The bold text in this help file is available in (?).

item.title: First project (16)
item.description: The transacation of the project, go an recuperate the information of the announcements of the first response page of google for a sentence entered with parameters

item.title: Create a new transaction
item.description:
In the tab Projects view, right click on the file Transactions of your project and next press on
>New
>Transaction
>Transaction HTML
>Next
>Finish
To add entry variables to your transaction, press on the proporiaty "Variables" (in properties view) of your transaction then on "...". Finally name your variables the way you think is right. From now on these variables are javascript variables and are accessible anywhere in the transaction.

item.title: First project (17)
item.description:
>Create a transaction which you will name "getData".
>Create a variable which you will name "wordToAnalyse". Also put an entry chain in the field "Default value" This will be the sentence that google will treat.

item.title: Create a Handler
item.description:
During the execution of a transaction, Convertigo will execute succesively the instructions contained in the handlers based on the schema of the algorithm of the handlers (available in (?)).
To create a handler, click right on the transaction in the tab Projects view, press on "new" next on "Handler".
Finally select the one(s) you like.

item.title: First project (18)
item.description:
>Right click on the transaction "getData" of the view Projects view
>Press on "new"next on "Handler".
>Click option "Screenclass transaction handler", choose the class "WelcomePage" then validate.(Leave the option "Entry handler coché" )

item.title: Create a statement
item.description:
For each, there are several instructions (Statement) that can be executed. The list is in (?) .
To add Statement to a handler, create an Xpath request which sends back the element or the action to be made.
Select the handler desired in the tab Projects view and press on the icon new Statement icon.
Choose the adapted Statement.
(You can also create a Statement by clicking right on the handler --> new --> Statement)

item.title: First project (19)
item.description:
The statement which you are going to create will fill automatically the search zone.
>Click right in the search zone of google (in the browser area).
>Then click right followed by "Generate selection Xpath" on the attribute title="Google Search".
>Click on the Handler "onWelcomePageEntry" of the file "Functions" of the transaction "getData"(Onglet Projects View)
>Click on the icon New statement icon and select the statement "Input HTML set value"
>In the propriaty "Expression" of this statement, replace "//todo" by "wordToAnalyse" (javascript variable created in step 17)

item.title: First project (20)
item.description:
Another statement will have as a goal to press automatically on the button search:
>Right click on the search button (of the browser area).
>Then click right followed by "Generate selection Xpath" on the attribute value="Google Search"".
>Click on the Handler "onWelcomePageEntry" of the file "Functions" of the transaction "getData"(Tab Projects View)
>Finally click on the icon New statement icon and select the statement "Mouse action"

item.title: Make your transactions communicative
item.description:
In the tab Projects view click on transaction.
In the tab properties view, put the propriaty « public Method » to the value true.
Right click on the transaction and click on « Extract WSDL Type » then on « yes ».
Now the key « Ctrl » and select in the list all the used elements of your transaction (choose them if you do not know which ones are used).
Repeat this for all your transactions.

item.title: First project (21)
item.description:

item.title: Test your transactions
item.description:
To test a transaction, right click on the selected transaction and press on "Execute".
The result isin the tab Output Tag of the browser area
